content.description: As sport routes go this is a good one.  Reasonably steep, continuous, and exposed knob-tugging up the arete to an exciting bulge.  No single move is 5.11a but the continuous nature keeps you honest.
content.location: Treasure Towers formation, between the Pink/White walls and on the way to Easy Street.  Obvious blunt arete on the right side of a gash in the cliff.

content.description: A link up of Buried Treasure & Goodbye to Dulcinea. Start on Buried Treasure and after clipping its 6th bolt, use sidepulls to climb left, joining Goodbye to Dulcinea at its 7th bolt.
content.location: Located in the middle of the wall. Same start as for Buried Treasure.

content.description: Start off the ledge 15 feet left of Buried Treasure. After clipping the 2nd bolt, go up and left and climb the inside, right face of the water chute finishing on the vertical face to its right.
content.location: Middle of the large orange buttress 20 feet right of the deep chimney.

content.description: Found on the left wall of the deep chimney. The Pearl is steeper than it looks. Climbs the vertical and slightly overhung face on a series of flat holds and cobbles to a steep finish.
content.location: After scrambling down the boulders below the Test Site, to the climber's left is a long deep chimney. The Pearl is found on the steep cobbled buttress that forms the left side of the chimney.

content.description: Begin as for Scrapin' the Barrel, after clipping its 2nd bolt continue up the overhung arete above before moving left at the end to finish at the shared anchors with Scrapin' the Barrel. A very pumpy route.
content.location: Begin off the ledge 15 feet left of Buried Treasure.

content.description: Climb the steep, cobbled face at the far right side of the formation. Heady due to the somewhat loose and sketchy rock. A steeper version of "Death by Chocolate." Should clean up and be a great route with additional ascents.
content.location: Far right side of the Treasure Towers formation

content.description:
An endurance test! Begin about two meters left of Buried Treasure on the small ledge. Immediately make a weird and hard move right, followed by a fun v5-ish boulder problem. Move right and up to an overhang; a v7-ish sequence takes you over. Do two hard and weather dependent lockoffs (cold and dry is your friend). Do a sequence of easier moves, followed by a v6ish boulder problem. From here, at about three fourths height, it is maybe 11c to the top. It is a challenge when you are pumped! (There are no good rests on the route, although a brief shake can be had at times.)

The route is clean enough to climb, but a brush will be nice.
content.protection: 9 bolts to two open shuts. Some may desire the second bolt stick clipped.
content.location: Left of Buried Treasure, right of Lucky Charms. Formerly known as the Shakedown Project.

content.description: Starts behind the bush, up the face, fun moves on knobs, pockets and edges. Just a touch more sustained than Windfall. An area classic.
content.location: The face to the right of Windfall

content.description: Climb straight up the middle of the wall. Steep climbing on good sized holds with no really hard single move.
Start on Dulcinea, climbing through big moves and small holds to the two pinch rest. Instead of finishing on Dulcinea's pumpy headwall, break right and finish on the easier Buried Treasure.
content.location: Climb Goodbye to Dulcinea to its sixth bolt then tread right and finish on Buried Treasure

content.description: One of the best stamina routes at the crag. Start on Buried Treasure and at its second bolt, traverse right to the next line of bolts. Follow this to the top of the right pillar. Stemming to the huge, right hand ramp at mid-height reduces the difficulty and rating.
content.location: Located at the right side of the wall. Furthest right route at Treasure Towers.
